defs: to dissolve mud, dirt or such other matter in water.
to stir up the mud, mire that is at the bottom of water, as to make the water dirty.
a number of people or things arranged so as to form a line; a row; a file.
a group, flock, herd, multitude or troop.
people sitting down in a row for taking meals.
any of a series of such horizontal lines in parallel, as of seats in a theatre or airplane, lines of plants in a field, etc.
a row of written or printed characters extending across or part way across a page; a line.
a single row of words or characters making up a unit of poetry, often, of a specified number of feet.
fame; reputation; renown.
a group, set or row of five.
(math.) a symbol for the number five.
(math.) a symbol for the number ten.
(pros.) a class of meters having ten syllables in each line.
a Vedic metre having five lines of eight syllables each.
partiality in serving guests.
ಪಂಕ್ತಿಭೇದ ಮಾಡು paŋkti bhēda māḍu to treat different people sitting in the same row differently or to treat a few preferentially or biasedly.
a community meal taken sitting down in a single row.
a meal taken sitting down with another person.
a man who is unfit to sit for taking meals with others in the same row.
a man who is fit to sit for taking meals with others in the same row.
any device for producing a current of air by the movement of a broad blades or a number of such surfaces; a fan.
= ಪಂಖ.
a part of one's income, produce, etc. that is to be given to the ruler as tax.
any woody extension growing from the trunk or main stem or from a main limb, of a tree or shrub; a branch.
anything of "U" or "V" shape.
= ಪಂಗುಳ.

any of several birds of the family Coraciidae that tumble or roll over in flight as Coracias indica, Boracus Indica the flight of which is consulted as an omen or Coracias benghalensis, etc.; the Indian roller.
a large number of people gathered closely together; a crowd.
a group of people constituting one side in a contest or competition; a team of players.
a group of people working together in a coordinated effort; a team of workers, doctors, etc.
that which is distinct, entirely different from another.
a group of people belonging to a particular tribe, social, religious class, etc.; a clan or sub-caste.
a deep, wide pit for catching wild elephants.
a penalty imposed on an individual who has defaulted in paying the tax to the king.
the fork-shaped sectarian mark the Śrīvaiṣṇavas put on their forehead.
(fig.) an action or device designed to deceive, cheat, outwit, etc.; artifice; a trick.
ಪಂಗನಾಮ ಹಾಕು paŋga nāma hāku to deceive or swindle; to trick.
a green, hence unripe, fruit.
a temporary roof of green leaves (as of coconut, mango leaves) erected on four poles, for a religious or social celebration.
a man who is indebted or obliged to another under obligation, moral responsibility or gratitude.
a man depending, relying on another.
the condition or fact of being indebted to another for a favour or service received; indebtedness; gratitude.
anything that is inevitable, unavoidable, etc.; necessity.
a favour, support, help, etc. received from another.
a strong wish or craving; a desire.
the fact of depending, relying on another; dependence.
a being connected or related; relation; connection.
crippled; impaired; not moving or functioning properly.
= ಪಂಗುಳ.
the state of being crippled; lameness.
Mīna, the twelfth month in the Hindu solar calendar.
a man having a crippled leg or legs; a lame man.
a contemptible or useless man.
a thing that is not frequently encountered or is scarce; a rare thing.
amounting to five in number; five.
the cardinal number five.
a member of the group of people who hear the evidence and inquire into the facts in a litigation in a village or town; a jury.
a member of a commission authorised to perform certain duties or tasks.
extending over a larger area from side to side than is usual or normal; wide; broad.
a group or set of five people, things or values.
that which is made of or consisting of five elements.
the site of a battle; battlefield.
a bundle (as of paper).
a measure of grains equal to five Koḷagas.
a land got as a tax-free gift.
(math.) a symbol for the number five.
(astrol.) a group of five consecutive lunar mansions (Mřgaśirā, ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, and āślēṣā).
the office of village juries.
a manner of wearing dhōti, tucking up at points.
a kind of sweet cake made using groundnut, jaggery, copra, fried Bengal gram, and sesame, for offering to a god.
a kind of dagger.
(pl.) the five organs - the eyes, ears, nose, tongue and skin.
(pl.) the five functional organs - speech, hands, feet, anus and sexual organs.
(pl.) the five internal organs, - the thoughts, intellect, ego, mind, and knowledge.
a closed plane figure with five angles and five sides; a pentagon.
a treatment that includes emetics, purgative medicines, sternutatories and enemas of two kinds (oily and non-oily).
(pl.) five small water vessels with a small mouths, used in worshipping and other auspicious occasions, as a symbol of the universe (or cosmic waters) and its generative power.
a horse with whose feet and mouth are white.
an elephant having auspicious features.
(Jain.) the five religious ceremonies observed during the life of a spiritual Jain teacher (from his birth to death).
= ಪಂಚಕಲ್ಯಾಣ - 1.
= ಪಂಚಕಚ್ಚೆ.

(pl.) the five artisans of a village - carpenters, goldsmiths, blacksmiths, masons and braziers (or, according to some, carpenters, weavers, barbers, washermen and cobblers).
a tax levied on the professions of these artisans.
(pl.) the five functions designed by the Divine Grace - creation, maintenance, final destruction, a being out of sight (disappearance) and benevolence (or bestowal).
(pl.) the five professions - swordsmanship, writing, agriculture, commerce and sculpture [?].
(geom.) a closed plane figure with five angles and five sides; a pentagon.
(myth.) one of the hells.
(pl.) the five spices - long pepper, its root, Piper chaba, plumbago and dry ginger.
(yoga.) (pl.) the five sheaths or vestures of the soul (the five layers forming the gross, subtle and causal bodies in the complex structure of the human personality).
(pl.) the five kinds of pains that afflict the soul.
(pl.) the five holiest Śaiva pilgrim centres in India - Sri Śaila, Kāśi, Kēdāra, Kāḷahasti, and Paṭṭisa.

a place where village juries generally meet to hear and decide the disputes of local people.
(pl.) the five things derived from the cow - milk, curds, clarified butter, urine and dung (held as auspicious).
a mixture of these things.
the wife of any of the men belonging to panca kāruka, the five kinds of artisans.
a woman belonging to any of these artisanś castes.

(fig.) extra-ordinary courage.
a tortoise that hides its four legs and the head in its hard shell.
the philosophic doctrine that matter is the only reality and that everything in the world, including thought, will, and feeling, can be explained only in terms of it; materialism.
a disease characterised by the enlargement of the spleen.
the five regions in ancient India - Sārasvata, Kānyākubja, Gauḍa, Utkala and Maithila.
(pl.) the five Brāhmaṇa clans originated from these regions.
(pl.) the languages of these five regions.

an ornament for elephants, consisting of large bells.
(pl.) the five classes of beings - gods, human beings, Gandharvas, serpents and manes.
a human being.
(pl.) the five expedients used in politics.
the well-known collection of moral stories and fables by Durgasimha.

the five subtle rudiments (sound, taste, physical feeling, sight, and smell) of the five basic elements.

one of the grades awarded to hotels depending on the facilities they offer to their customers.
a necklace having five strings.

the aggregate of five.
the five elements collectively.
five-foldness.
cessation of life; death.
amounting to fifteen in number; fifteen.
next after the fourteenth in a consecutive series; fifteenth.
the cardinal number fifteen; 15.
the last of a lunar fortnight (either full moon-day or new moon-day).
a kind of large mounted gun; a cannon.

(pl.) the five Dravidian languages - Kannaḍa, Tamil, Telugu, Malayāḷa and Tuḷu.
pure cane-sugar; refined sugar.
the five paces of a horse.
the decision of the juries or a report written in the presence of juries.

a list of things recovered from a thief or details written about a murder, confiscation, etc. written in detail, and attested by the concerned officials along with the persons who witnessed the process.
(pl.) the five kinds of leaves - of mango, Beal (Aegle marmelos), Indian gooseberry (Emblica officinalis), a king of grass (Saccharum spontaneum) and chaff plant (Achyranthes aspera).
the plant Blumea lacera (var. glandulosa) of Astraceae family (?).

(pl.) the five days - the eighth and fourteenth days of lunar fortnight, full moon-day, new moon-day and sankrānti - considered auspicious for special types of services to the god.

(phil.) (pl.) five types of ignorance.
a vessel having five cups attached together with a handle, used to serve different types of foods simultaneously.
any utensil or container having a wide mouth.

(pl.) (pl.) the five venerable persons to whom one must be grateful in life - father, spiritual teacher, general teacher (or, according to some, father-in-law), he who fed, and he who protected.
the five Muslim Souls who are believed to be the protectors on the sea.
(pl.) five kinds of proofs that we get from five organs (the eyes, ears, nose, tongue and skin).
(pl.) the knowledge got from these five organs.
the five vital airs that maintain the functions of the body.
(fig.) that which one likes, loves too much.
a highly mischievous boy or man.
(pl.) five things offered to the Goddess Kāḷi, - buffalo, sheep, goat, sugar-cane and pumpkin.
(pl.) the five types of sexual incitements or influences (figuratively conceived as five arrows of flowers, that inflicts pleasant pain) the Love-God Manmatha, has on human beings.
Manmatha, himself.
(pl.) the five items that accounts for a major share in the total revenue of a government (toddy, liquor, opium, marijuana and tax).

five kinds of sweets.

the fifth one in a consecutive series.

that which is beautiful, lovely.

sexual intercourse.

either of the two strings of a musical instrument that produce this note when played or plucked allowing it to be free.
(mus.) a mode in Karnāṭaka system derived from the mode Mālava Gauḷa (as per some classification).
(mus.) a mode in Hindūstāni system, derived from the main mode Śuddhabhairav.

(pl.) the five practices some Śaiva cults profess - eating of fish and flesh, liquor, particular countenances for meditation, and sexual intercourse (all of which in Samskřta starts with the letter 'ಮ').

(mus.) name of a musical mode.

(sometimes, in singular number, it refers to any of) the five artisans of a village - carpenters, goldsmiths, blacksmiths, masons and braziers (or, according to some, carpenters, weavers, barbers, washermen and cobblers).
that which is made of five components or which has five parts.
the five things - solar days, lunar days, asterisms, yōgas and karaṇās, which the Indian almanac considers.

the Indian almanac, based on these five things, that determines the beginning, length, and divisions of a year, month, day, etc. giving information daywise along with astronomical data, weather forecasts, etc., usu. published annually.
